item.title: Baljit add a quote by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
item.description: "I think you travel to search and you come back home to find yourself there." -- Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Manil Suri
item.description: "What did religion do to people, to provoke such obstinancy, such hysteria - how did it push people to the stage of torturing themselves and killing each other? " -- Manil Suri

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Steve Jobs
item.description:
"Don’t let the noise of others’ opinions drown out your own inner voice."
[<i>Stanford University commencement speech</i>, 2005]" -- Steve Jobs

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "It was always the view of my parents...that hot weather encouraged loose morals among young people." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Tony Robbins
item.description: "Identify your problems but give your power and energy to solutions." -- Tony Robbins

item.title: Baljit add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Caroline Gordon
item.description: "A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way." -- Caroline Gordon

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Hilary Mantel
item.description: "I you ask me about the monks, I speak from experience, not prejudice, and though I have no doubt that some foundations are well governed, my experience has been of waste and corruption. May I suggest to Your Majesty that, if you wish to see a parade of the seven deadly sins, you do not organise a masque at court but call without notice at a monastery?" -- Hilary Mantel

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Vikram Seth
item.description: "But I too hate long books: the better, the worse. If they're bad they merely make me pant with the effort of holding them up for a few minutes. But if they're good, I turn into a social moron for days, refusing to go out of my room, scowling and growling at interruptions, ignoring weddings and funerals, and making enemies out of friends. I still bear the scars of Middlemarch." -- Vikram Seth

item.title: Baljit add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description:
"Reader's Bill of Rights
1. The right to not read
2. The right to skip pages
3. The right to not finish
4. The right to reread
5. The right to read anything
6. The right to escapism
7. The right to read anywhere
8. The right to browse
9. The right to read out loud
10. The right to not defend your tastes" -- Daniel Pennac
